locations.name: Mana Pools National Park
locations.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site on the Zambezi River floodplain, famous for walking safaris, canoeing, and close wildlife encounters, especially elephants.

locations.name: Lake Kariba
locations.description: One of the world's largest man-made lakes, known for its stunning sunsets, boat excursions, fishing, and wildlife viewing along the shoreline.

locations.name: Hwange National Park
locations.description: Zimbabwe's largest national park, renowned for its massive elephant population and diverse wildlife including lions, leopards, wild dogs, across varied savanna and woodland habitats.
